result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry Lorenzo Weston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 9 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $453 costs, consecutive to sentence.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terry Lorenzo Weston in court in custody with attorney Philip J. Brehm.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 51 days Rock Co Jail; 9 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $453 costs, consecutive to sentence; 37 days sentence credit; bond to be refunded.
